Exceptional;Bolting Strikes | weapon_focus = | poss_enchantments = | rel_quests = | rel_items = | rel_abilities = | rel_talents = | internalname = Pollaxe_Soulbound_Lord_Darryns_Voulge | location = * Can be scavenged from a shipwreck on an island to the far southeast of [Neketaka Island](/neketakaIsland/) and south of [Tikawara](/tikawara/), at the coordinates 37째 21' S, 55째 30' E. | guid = cb83a6b3-92bb-4b62-8255-59e4e4e20081 }}__NOTOC__ [290px](/filePoe2SketchCorsairsVoulgePng/) '''{{Pagename nd}}''' is a [soulbound](/soulbound/) {{lc:Pollaxe}} in {{poe2}}. It can only be bound to a [Barbarian](/barbarian/), [Druid](/druid/), or [Fighter](/fighter/). ## Description ###### Base {{Description |{{#var:description}}}} ###### Level 1 {{Description|Enemies crushed, we filled our hold
With all our ill-gotten gold
''Riches for my lover dear'' Ere a fortnight passed we struck again
Sank two sloops under pounding rain
''Godsdamn them once and damn them twice
Lord Darryn promised gold and glittering prizes'' Lord Darryn brought the storms to heel
And lightning struck from stern to keel ''We were brave young fools and surely mad
We couldn't be stopped we were Darryn's lads''}} ###### Level 2 {{Description|We sailed and fought for the kin
All loyal brigands of the sea
''Judge me not, my lover dear'' We sailed through squalls and maelstroms
Crushed rebel fleets with thunderstorms
''Godsdamn them once and damn them twice
Lord Darryn promised gold and glittering prizes'' Blood and broke timber did abound
But there was no plunder to be found
''We were brave young fools and surely mad
We couldn't be stopped we were Darryn's lads''}} ###### Level 3 {{Description|It couldn't stand, he had to know
Lord Darryn turned from friend to foe
''I'll come home soon my lover dear'' We took our chance, we mutineers
But he wouldn't back down, he had no fear
'Godsdamn him once and damn him twice
Godsdamn he promised us glittering prizes'' He called lightning down upon our heads
Burned the boat and struck us dead
''We were brave young fools and surely mad
Only Lord Darryn could kill Darryn's lads'' ''Forgive me please my lover dear''}} ## Acquisition {{#arraymap: {{#var:location}}|;|x|x|\n}} ## Soulbound upgrades {{side note|Barbarian class Level 2 upgrade replaces [Static Charge](/staticCharge/)}} {| class="wikitable sortable" ! [Fighter](/fighter/) | align="center" | {{cp2|5270}} | align="center" | 20-32 | * [Ball Lightning](/ballLightningEnchantment/): {{Cargo enchantment effects|Ball Lightning (enchantment)}} * [Superb](/superbWeaponDeadfire/): {{Cargo enchantment effects|Superb weapon (Deadfire)}} |} ## Behind the scenes * The description for Lord Darryn's Voulge bears resemblance to the [http://stanrogers.net/the-music/song-archive/barretts-privateers/ lyrics] in the song [Barrett's Privateers](/wikipediaBarrettsPrivateers/) by musician Stan Rogers, describing a fight between a Canadian privateer and an American (rebel) ship. ** ''"'Twus the spring of 2668"'' - ''"O the year was 1778"''. ** ''"We had a letter from Aedyr givin' plunderin' rights"'' - ''"A Letter of Marque came from the King"''. ** And of course the chorus: ''"Godsdamn them once and damn them twice Lord Darryn promised gold and glittering prizes"'' - ''"Goddamn them all, I was told, we'd cruise the seas for American gold"''. ###### Concept art and renders by Ian Randall ian-randall-concept-soulbound-poleaxe.jpg|Silhouette sketch ian-randall-highpoly(1).jpg|High poly model ian-randall-marmo(1).jpg
